fields.headline: Best of the net
fields.bodyText: Nearly winter - and time for another flurry of new skiing sites. None of them can rival Ifyouski.com, which has cleverly spotted a gap in the market with SMS snow reports for the most popular resorts for a one-off fee of £1, and a brand new section on ski technique. skisolutions.com Britain's largest specialist skiing agency has upgraded its site, with more details on each hotel and a promise to trawl for unfilled rooms even when the hotel is officially full (because a tour operator has booked most of it). motours.com Aimed at those who either want to drive to the Alps, book their own no-frills flights or hop aboard the ski train to Bourg-St Maurice. alptxt.com Expect lots of new services like this one. It's a free après-ski update for nine French resorts run by the seasonal workers' site, Natives.co.uk. esf.net/welcome.htm The French national skiing school promises an online lesson booking service in the near future - which is pretty optimistic given the current state of the site. spainalive.com/spain/skiing/index.jsp Spain has very few decent travel websites in English. Happily, this guide to resorts in the Pyrenees is an exception. ski.visitscotland.com Not, strictly speaking, a new site - but it has been drastically improved since last year. Realising that the lack of decent packages is the main obstacle to skiing in Scotland, the site has revamped its accommodation and travel sections. ros.taylor@theguardian.com
